original: Paṭṭhānapakaraṇa
analyzed: paṭṭhāna pakaraṇa
translated: The Book of Conditional Relations🔽The Chapter on the Conditions in Reverse Order🔽The Chapter on the Conditions in Direct Order

original: Dhammapaccanīyānuloma (4), Dukatikapaṭṭhānapāḷi (3)🔽21.52. Mahantaraduka, Sanidassanattika🔽Nasārammaṇaṁ nasanidassanasappaṭighaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca anārammaṇo sanidassanasappaṭigho dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … ekaṁ.🔽Naanārammaṇaṁ nasanidassanasappaṭighaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca anārammaṇo sanidassanasappaṭigho🔽dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … ekaṁ. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā tīṇi, adhipatiyā tīṇi …pe… avigate tīṇi.🔽(Anidassanasappaṭighe tīṇiyeva.) Hetuyā tīṇi, adhipatiyā tīṇi …pe… aññamaññe ekaṁ …pe… avigate tīṇi.
analyzed: dhamma paccanīya anuloma duka tika paṭṭhāna pāḷi  mahantara duka sani dassana ttika  na sa ārammaṇam na sa nidassana sappaṭigham dhammam paṭicca anārammaṇaḥ sa nidassana sappaṭighaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā eka  na anārammaṇam na sa nidassana sa paṭigham dhammam paṭicca anārammaṇaḥ sa nidassana sa paṭighaḥ  dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā eka saṅkhitta hetuyā tīṇi adhipatiyā tīṇi pe avigate tīṇi  anidassana sa paṭighe tīṇi yeva hetuyā tīṇi adhipatiyā tīṇi pe aññamaññe ekam pe avigate tīṇi
translated: The Chapter on the Conditions in Direct Order with the Threes

original: Nasārammaṇaṁ naanidassanaappaṭighaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca anārammaṇo anidassanaappaṭigho dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā ekaṁ, adhipatiyā ekaṁ …pe… avigate ekaṁ.
analyzed: na sa ārammaṇam na anidassana appaṭigham dhammam paṭicca anārammaṇaḥ anidassana appaṭighaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā eka adhipatiyā ekaṃ pe avigate eka
translated: With an object that is not supramundane, not directly-knowable, and has impingement, a resultant, not-inexplicable, not-detectable, not-inconstant, not-variable, not-indigent, not-noble, not-beautiful, not-peaceful, not-retorted, not-with-root, not-cause, not-condition, not-nutriment, not-element, not-world, not-clinging, not-source, not-track, not-site, not-medium, not-language, not-source of discourse, not-appearance, not-origin, not-foundation, not-birth, not-source of birth, not-phenomenon, not-guiding, not-leading, not-having training, not-with-training, not-having investigation, not-with-investigation, not-having a faculty, not-with-a-faculty, not-having a feeling, not-with-a-feeling, not-having perception, not-with-perception, not-having volition, not-with-volition, not-having contact, not-with-contact, not-having attention, not-with-attention, not-having applied thought, not-with-applied-thought, not-having sustained thought, not-with-sustained-thought, not-having happiness, not-with-happiness, not-having pleasure, not-with-pleasure, not-having the faculty of pleasure, not-with-the-faculty-of-pleasure, not-having the faculty of joy, not-with-the-faculty-of-joy, not-having the faculty of life, not-with-the-faculty-of-life, not-having calm, not-with-calm, not-having mastery, not-with-mastery, not-having concentration, not-with-concentration, not-having wisdom, not-with-wisdom, not-having deliverance, not-with-deliverance, not-having the knowledge and vision of deliverance, not-with-the-knowledge-and-vision-of-deliverance, not-having the fruit of stream-entry, not-with-the-fruit-of-stream-entry

original: Nocittaṁ nasanidassanasappaṭighaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nocitto sanidassanasappaṭigho dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … ekaṁ.
analyzed: no cittam na sa nidassana sa paṭigham dhammam paṭicca no cittaḥ sa nidassana sa paṭighaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā eka
translated: With a non-mental, non-visible, non-impacting dhamma as condition, a non-mental, visible, impactive dhamma arises, by way of root-condition. … one …

original: Nanocittaṁ nasanidassanasappaṭighaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nocitto sanidassanasappaṭigho dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … ekaṁ. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na no cittam na sa nidassana sa paṭigham dhammam paṭicca no cittaḥ sa nidassana sa paṭighaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā eka
translated: With a non-mental, non-visible, non-impacting dhamma as condition, a non-mental, visible, impactive dhamma arises, by way of root-condition. … one … (Abbreviated.)

original: Hetuyā tīṇi, adhipatiyā tīṇi …pe… avigate tīṇi.
analyzed: hetuyā tīṇi adhipatiyā tīṇi pe avigate tīṇi
translated: With respect to root, there are three; with respect to predominance, there are three; … with respect to absence, there are three.

original: Nacetasikaṁ nasanidassanasappaṭighaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nacetasiko sanidassanasappaṭigho dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na cetasikam na sa nidassana sa paṭigham dhammam paṭicca na cetasikaḥ sa nidassana sa paṭighaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta
translated: With a non-mental factor, non-visible, non-impacting dhamma as condition, a non-mental factor, visible, impactive dhamma arises, by way of root-condition. (Abbreviated.)

original: Hetuyā tīṇi, adhipatiyā tīṇi …pe… avigate tīṇi.
analyzed: hetuyā tīṇi adhipatiyā tīṇi pe avigate tīṇi
translated: With respect to root, there are three; with respect to predominance, there are three; … with respect to absence, there are three.

original: Nacittasampayuttaṁ nasanidassanasappaṭighaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca cittavippayutto sanidassanasappaṭigho dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na citta sampayuttam na sa nidassana sappaṭigham dhammam paṭicca citta vippayuttaḥ sa nidassana sappaṭighaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With a dhamma associated with mind, non-visible, non-impacting as condition, a dhamma dissociated from mind, visible, impactive arises, by way of root-condition. (Abbreviated.)

original: Hetuyā tīṇi, adhipatiyā tīṇi …pe… avigate tīṇi.
analyzed: hetuyā tīṇi adhipatiyā tīṇi pe avigate tīṇi
translated: With respect to root, there are three; with respect to predominance, there are three; … with respect to absence, there are three.

original: Nacittasaṁsaṭṭhaṁ nasanidassanasappaṭighaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca cittavisaṁsaṭṭho sanidassanasappaṭigho dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽Hetuyā tīṇi, adhipatiyā tīṇi …pe… avigate tīṇi.🔽Nocittasamuṭṭhānaṁ nasanidassanasappaṭighaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca cittasamuṭṭhāno sanidassanasappaṭigho dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Cittasamuṭṭhānarūpeneva tīṇi. Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽Hetuyā tīṇi, adhipatiyā tīṇi …pe… avigate tīṇi.🔽Nocittasahabhuṁ nasanidassanasappaṭighaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nocittasahabhū sanidassanasappaṭigho dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na citta sasaṭṭham na sa nidassana sappaṭigham dhammam paṭicca citta visasaṭṭhaḥ sa nidassana sappaṭighaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta  hetuyā tīṇi adhipatiyā tīṇi pe avigate tīṇi  no citta samuṭṭhānam na sa nidassana sa paṭigham dhammam paṭicca citta samuṭṭhānaḥ sa nidassana sa paṭighaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā citta samuṭṭhāna rūpena iva tīṇi  hetuyā tīṇi adhipatiyā tīṇi pe avigate tīṇi  no citta sahabhum na sa nidassana sa paṭigham dhammam paṭicca no citta sahabhū sa nidassana sa paṭighaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā

original: Nocittānuparivattiṁ nasanidassanasappaṭighaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nocittānuparivattī sanidassanasappaṭigho dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: no citta anuparivattim na sa nidassana sa paṭigham dhammam paṭicca no citta anuparivattī sa nidassana sa paṭighaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: Dependent on a state that is not a mental factor and that is not a concomitant of consciousness, and that is visible and has impingement, there arises a state that is not a mental factor and that is not a concomitant of consciousness, and that is visible and has impingement, through a root-cause condition. (In brief:)

original: Hetuyā tīṇi, adhipatiyā tīṇi …pe… avigate tīṇi.
analyzed: hetuyā tīṇi adhipatiyā tīṇi pe avigate tīṇi
translated: In the section on root-cause there are three triplets and three duals.

original: Nocittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhānaṁ nasanidassanasappaṭighaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nocittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhāno sanidassanasappaṭigho dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: no citta sa saṭṭha samuṭṭhānam na sa nidassana sa paṭigham dhammam paṭicca no citta sa saṭṭha samuṭṭhānaḥ sa nidassana sa paṭighaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta
translated: Dependent on a state that is not associated with mind and that arises together with mind, and that is visible and has impingement, there arises a state that is not associated with mind and that arises together with mind, and that is visible and has impingement, through a root-cause condition. (In brief:)

original: Hetuyā tīṇi, adhipatiyā tīṇi …pe… avigate tīṇi.
analyzed: hetuyā tīṇi adhipatiyā tīṇi pe avigate tīṇi
translated: In the section on root-cause there are three triplets and three duals.

original: Nocittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhānasahabhuṁ nasanidassanasappaṭighaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nocittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhānasahabhū sanidassanasappaṭigho dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: no citta sa saṭṭha samuṭṭhāna sahabhum na sa nidassana sappaṭigham dhammam paṭicca no citta sa saṭṭha samuṭṭhāna sahabhū sa nidassana sappaṭighaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta
translated: Dependent on a state that is not associated with mind and that arises together with mind, and that is visible and has impingement, there arises a state that is not associated with mind and that arises together with mind, and that is visible and has impingement, through a root-cause condition. (In brief:)

original: Hetuyā tīṇi, adhipatiyā tīṇi …pe… avigate tīṇi.
analyzed: hetuyā tīṇi adhipatiyā tīṇi pe avigate tīṇi
translated: In the section on root-cause there are three triplets and three duals.

original: Nocittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhānānuparivattiṁ nasanidassanasappaṭighaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nocittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhānānuparivattī🔽sanidassanasappaṭigho dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽Hetuyā tīṇi, adhipatiyā tīṇi …pe… avigate tīṇi.🔽Naajjhattikaṁ nasanidassanasappaṭighaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca bāhiro sanidassanasappaṭigho dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … ekaṁ.
analyzed: no citta sa saṭṭha samuṭṭhāna anuparivattim na sanidassana sappaṭigham dhammam paṭicca no citta sa saṭṭha samuṭṭhāna anuparivattī  sa nidassana sa paṭighaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā  hetuyā tīṇi adhipatiyā tīṇi pe avigate tīṇi  na ajjhattikam na sanidassana sappaṭigham dhammam paṭicca bāhiraḥ sanidassana sappaṭighaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā eka
translated: Dependent on a state that is not originated by mind and that is not a condition by way of decisive support for what is originated by mind, there arises a state that is not originated by mind and that is not a condition by way of decisive support for what is originated by mind, which is a visible datum, a tangible datum.🔽Dependent on a state that is not originated by mind and that is not a condition by way of decisive support for what is originated by mind, there arises a state that is not originated by mind and that is not a condition by way of decisive support for what is originated by mind, which is a visible datum, a tangible datum, and a non-existent datum.🔽(In brief:)🔽With respect to root cause there are three; with respect to predominance there are three; … with respect to non-hindrance there are three.🔽Dependent on a state that is internal, a visible datum, a tangible datum, there arises a state that is external, a visible datum, a tangible datum, a non-existent datum. … one.

original: Nabāhiraṁ nasanidassanasappaṭighaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca bāhiro sanidassanasappaṭigho dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … ekaṁ. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽Hetuyā tīṇi, adhipatiyā tīṇi …pe… avigate tīṇi.🔽Noupādā nasanidassanasappaṭighaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca upādā sanidassanasappaṭigho dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na bāhiram na sa nidassana sappaṭigham dhammam paṭicca bāhiraḥ sa nidassana sappaṭighaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā eka 🔽hetuyā tīṇi adhipatiyā tīṇi pe avigate tīṇi 🔽no upādā na sa nidassana sa paṭigham dhammam paṭicca upādā sa nidassana sa paṭighaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta
translated: Dependent on a state that is not originated by mind and that is not a condition by way of decisive support for what is originated by mind and is not a condition by way of decisive support original: Hetuyā ekaṁ, adhipatiyā ekaṁ …pe… avigate ekaṁ.🔽Naupādinnaṁ nasanidassanasappaṭighaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca anupādinno sanidassanasappaṭigho dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: adhipatiyā ekam pe avigate eka  na aupādinnam na sanidassana sappaṭigham dhammam paṭicca anupādinnaḥ sanidassana sappaṭighaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta
translated: With respect to cause, there is one. With respect to predominance, there is one. … With respect to non-hindrance, there is one.🔽With an object that is not clung to and has form and impinges, there arises a consciousness that is not clung to and has form and impinges. (In brief.)

original: Hetuyā tīṇi, adhipatiyā tīṇi …pe… avigate tīṇi.
analyzed: hetuyā tīṇi adhipatiyā tīṇi pe avigate tīṇi
translated: With respect to cause, there are three. With respect to predominance, there are three. … With respect to non-hindrance, there are three.
